segments.text: Hi Jessica, thanks for making time today.
Of course! I'm excited to hear the new tracks. How's the album coming along?
Really well actually. We've got seven songs fully recorded and mixed. Three more in various stages.
That's great progress. Are you still on track for the April release date we discussed?
Yeah, I think so. We need to wrap recording by end of February, which feels doable. Then mastering in March.
Perfect. And how are you feeling about the direction? Last time we talked you were worried about the production feeling too polished.
Yeah, that was a real concern. But we've been mixing in more analog gear and keeping some of the imperfections. It feels more authentic now.
I love that. The rawness is what connected with people on your last EP. We don't want to lose that.
Exactly. So, I wanted to talk about marketing strategy. I've been thinking about doing some acoustic sessions for social media.
Oh that's perfect timing. We were going to suggest building up content in February and March before the release.
Great minds. I was thinking stripped down versions of the album tracks, maybe film them in different locations around the city.
I really like that. It gives fans a peek behind the curtain and shows the songs in a different light.
Exactly. And I want to be more personal this time. Talk about what inspired each song, the stories behind them.
That vulnerability is what your fans love. Let's schedule a planning session with the marketing team to map this out.
Perfect. Oh, and one more thing - I want to do a small club tour after the release. Like 10-15 cities, intimate venues.
I love it. We'll start reaching out to venues. Are you thinking May or June?
June would be ideal. Gives us time to build momentum from the release.
Sounds like a plan. Send me the finished tracks when you're ready and we'll start building the rollout.
